Definition at line 31 of file area.cpp.

◆ get_distance()

bool area::get_distance ( cpswarm_msgs::GetDist::Request &  req,
cpswarm_msgs::GetDist::Response &  res 
)

Return the distance of a given point to the area boundary (outside or inside the area). Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10983872/distance-from-a-point-to-a-polygon and https://stackoverflow.com/questions/849211/shortest-distance-between-a-point-and-a-line-segment.

Parameters
reqThe coordinates of the point to check. If it is empty (0,0), the area origin is used.
resThe coordinates of the closest area boundary line segment, the coordinates of the closest point on the boundary, and the distance.
Returns
Whether request succeeded.

Definition at line 61 of file area.cpp.

◆ get_gridmap()

nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid area::get_gridmap ( bool  rotated = false,
double  resolution = 0 
)
protected

Generate a grid map from the given area coordinates.

Parameters
rotationWhether the map bottom edge should be aligned horizontally, default false.
resolutionResolution of the map in meter / cell, default 0, i.e., using value provided by parameter server or subscribed map.
Returns
A grid map that represents the area.

Definition at line 186 of file area.cpp.

◆ get_map()

bool area::get_map ( cpswarm_msgs::GetMap::Request &  req,
cpswarm_msgs::GetMap::Response &  res 
)

Return the map that represents the area.

Parameters
reqThe desired resolution of the map and whether its bottom edge should be aligned horizontally and the origin should be an integer.
resThe grid map of the environment together with the angle it has been rotated by and the offset it has been translated by.
Returns
Whether the request succeeded.

◆ on_bound()

bool area::on_bound ( pair< double, double >  pos,
double  angle 
)
private

Test whether a point is on the area boundary.

Parameters
posPoint to test
angleThe angle to rotate the area by, radian, counter-clockwise, default 0.
Returns
True, if the distance from p0 to p2 and from p2 to p1 is almost the same as from p0 to p1, false otherwise.

cpswarm_msgs::OutOfBounds::Response &  res 
)

Determine whether a position is within the area.

Parameters
reqThe position to check.
resTrue, if the position is outside of the area, false otherwise.
Returns
Whether the request succeeded.

◆ out_of_bounds() [2/2]

bool area::out_of_bounds ( pair< double, double >  pos,
double  angle = 0 
)
private

Determine whether a position is within the area using the winding number algorithm.

Parameters
posThe position to check.
angleThe angle to rotate the area by, radian, counter-clockwise, default 0.
Returns
True, if the position is outside of the area boundary, false otherwise.

◆ translate()

geometry_msgs::Vector3 area::translate ( nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid &  map)
private

Shift a map to be aligned with the grid, i.e., the origin should be an even number.

Parameters
mapA reference to the occupancy grid map to shift.
Returns
A vector that specifies the amount that the map has been shifted in x and y direction.

◆ coords_sorted

map<double,map<double, pair<double,double> > > area::coords_sorted
private

The coordinates of the area at different rotations, sorted counter-clockwise about the center, starting from negative x-axis [-π,π]. They are mapped by the respective angle.

Mapping from rotation angle to mapping from angle around origin to coordinate.
